info.label: Junior Software & Web Developer
info.brief:
LinkedIn GitHub Steemit
Soon to be college graduate majoring in Computer Science with passion for development and technology

employment.summary: Optional overall employment summary. Not used in most themes.

history.summary: Part-time overnight team member primarily responsible for receiving trucks and stocking shelves to company standards
highlights: Multiple 'Whole Bean' awards for performing beyond expectations
Trained and certified to use electric pallet jack and loading dock
Adjusted well to the new culture and protocols following Amazon's acquisition of the company due to my previous experience working at the Amazon fulfillment center

history.summary: Early arriver to a small start-up company specializing in electronics recycling where I gained experience doing a little bit of everything needed to start and grow the business
highlights: Led effort to refurbish and resell items online bringing in additional revenue for the company
Provided technical support to office staff and maintained all office equipment, almost always done using only recycled parts
Helped in warehouse and at recycling events including frequent use of forklift

history.summary: Started off working through temporary employment service, but quickly hired on directly by Amazon.com to work in the ABE2 fulfillment center
highlights: Performed in multiple capacities throughout the fulfillment center but primarily on the receiving end
Worked during peak season averaging between 50-60 hours every week for a long stretch of time
Given expert permissions after successfully passing audits to work as a problem solver

projects.title: Hitchcoin Mobile Ride Sharing Application
projects.summary: First experience leading a team through the full development process. We started with class/uml diagrams, software development and requirement specification sheets, flow-charts, etc. and eventually began coding our project. While we fell short of our original goals for the project in the given time frame, the agile development process gave us a working prototype meeting all of our architectural needs while leaving many of the desired features to be completed down the road
highlights: Built a cross-platform mobile application (iOS and Android) using JavaScript and the React Native Library
Used all AWS cloud based resources including: AppSync, Cognito, DynamoDB, GraphQL API, Lambda, Pinpoint Analytics, S3, and more...
Learned how to collaborate effectively using online tools to work concurrently on the same code base

projects.title: Concurrent, Connection-Based Download Server
projects.summary: Basic download server written in C++ using sockets to allow clients to connect and download files
projects.description: Basic download server written in C++ using sockets to allow clients to connect and download files. Worked with a partner (who built client application) to establish a network protocol establishing a small set of messages that were used to coordinate all communications between the client(s) and server.
highlights: Supports concurrent use with multiple clients
Uses socket utility functions with error checking for all network actions

history.title: BS Computer Science
history.summary: Graduating Fall 2019 with over 140 hours credit - Current GPA: 3.71

recognition.from: Brigham Young University, East Tennessee State University, and Kutztown University
recognition.title: DEAN'S LIST
recognition.summary: For Summer '09, Fall '10, Spring '17, Fall '17, Spring '18, and Fall '18 Semesters
